data.name: BackupAllButtonTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi Click to \b select \b0 all games for backup. The selection can be modified in the check box list. }

data.name: BackupCancelButtonTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi Cancels the backup procedure and navigates back to the main menu. }

data.name: BackupCheckListTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi Customize your selection of games to backup. \b NOTE: \b0 Older games that utilize Valve's Source Engine share resources between each other, However Valve has patched this out. Make sure you have the latest version of these old steam games, this tool will not be able to backup or restore them otherwise. }

data.name: BackupNoneButtonTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi Click to \b deselect \b0 all games for backup. The selection can be modified in the check box list. }

data.name: BackupStartButtonTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi Starts the backup procedure with the above parameters }

data.name: BackupSteamRunningText
data.value: Please exit Steam before backing up. To continue, exit Steam and then click the 'Backup' button again. Do Not start Steam until the backup process is finished.

data.name: CompressionLevelText
data.value: Compression Level:

data.name: CompressionTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi This will change how small the backup files are. Higher compression levels will use more ram and take longer but will result in far better compression. }

data.name: ControlsDefaultTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi Hover your mouse over the controls to get further information. }

data.name: DelBackupCheckBoxTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi This will delete \b EVERYTHING \b0 in the 'Backup Directory'. Make sure that there are no valuable files in there! }

data.name: ErrorListHeader
data.value:
Listed below are the errors for a backup or restore.
Please try running the backup process again making sure that there are no programs accessing the files being backed up (e.g. Steam).
To check the integrity of this backup: navigate to the backup location -> Select all files in the 'common' folder -> right click -> 7zip -> Test archive. You should do the same for 'Source Games.7z' also.

data.name: InstancesCountTooltip
data.value: Choose the number of instances to run. Recommended: One instance for every two CPU cores.

data.name: Lzma2CheckboxTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi This will use multi threaded compression and reduce concurrent compression instances to 1. The compressed archives have similar sizes compared to LZMA compression. }

data.name: MaxRamUsageText
data.value: Max Ram Usage: {0:g}MB

data.name: RestoreAllButtonTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi Click to \b select \b0 all games in the list. The selection can be modified in the check box list. }

data.name: RestoreCancelButtonTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi Cancels the restore procedure and navigates back to the main menu. }

data.name: RestoreCheckListTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi Customise your selection of games to restore. \b NOTE: \b0 Older games that utilize Valve's Source Engine share resources between each other, However Valve has patched this out. Make sure you have the latest version of these old steam games, this tool will not be able to backup or restore them otherwise. }

data.name: RestoreNoneButtonTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi Click to \b deselect \b0 all games in the list. The selection can be modified in the check box list. }

data.name: RestoreRefreshListLabelTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi Allows for some games to be restored to a alternative library. }

data.name: RestoreStartButtonTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi Starts the restore procedure with the above parameters. \b This will overwrite any currently installed Steam games with the back up files. \b0 }

data.name: RestoreSteamRunningText
data.value: Please exit Steam before restoring. To continue, exit Steam and then click the 'Start Restore' button again. Do Not start Steam until the restore process is finished.

data.name: RestoreThreadsTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi This will change how many threads are used. Doesn't use much ram and can only utilizes one core per instance. }

data.name: SteamRunningTitle
data.value: Steam Is Running

data.name: ThreadLblInstancesText
data.value: Number Of Instances:

data.name: ThreadLblThreadsText
data.value: Number Of Threads:

data.name: ThreadsCountTooltip
data.value: Choose the number of Threads to run. Recommended: One Thread for every CPU core.

data.name: ThreadsLzma2Tooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi This will change how many threads are used. It is recommended that you set the slider to \b 'core_count' \b0 for best performance. Dramatically increases ram usage when also using high compression rates. }

data.name: ThreadsLzmaTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi This will change how many instances of 7zip are used, each instance creates two threads. It is recommended that you set the slider to \b 'core_count/2' \b0 for best performance. Dramatically increases ram usage when also using high compression rates. }

data.name: UpdateBackupButtonTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi Click to select all games that have been changed since the last backup, \b Excluding \b0 games that have not been backed up yet. The selection can be modified in the check box list. }

data.name: UpdateLibButtonTooltip
data.value: {\rtf1\ansi Click to select all games that have been changed since the last backup, \b Including \b0 games that have not been backed up yet. The selection can be modified in the check box list. }

Jobs finished with {0} of {1} completed!
Steam Backup Tool finished without finding any errors.

data.value: Finished Successfully

data.name: FinishedWithErrorsText
data.value:
WARNING!
Jobs finished with {0} of {1} completed!
However, Steam Backup Tool has encountered error, It is recommended that you look at the 'Error Log.txt' file in the backup directory for a full list of errors.

data.name: FinishedWithErrorsTitle
data.value: Errors Found

data.value: Steam Install Directory

data.name: BackupDir
data.value: Backup Directory

data.name: CancelQueryText
data.value: Do you want to cancel immediately? This could corrupt the games that are currently being worked on. Click 'Yes' to stop immediately, or 'No' to cancel once the current jobs have been finished.

data.name: CancelQueryTitle
data.value: Cancel immediately?

data.value: Pause

data.name: ResumeText
data.value: Resume

data.name: SteamFolderNotFound
data.value:
Sorry, But I could not find where steam has been installed.
Please browse for it manually.
